itemLabel: Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley

wikipedia_page.main: Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley (née FitzClarence; August 1796 – 10 April 1837) was the eldest illegitimate daughter of William IV of the United Kingdom and his longtime mistress Dorothea Jordan. She was married to Philip Sidney, 1st Baron De L'Isle and Dudley, and had four surviving children. Shortly before her death in 1837, she served as State Housekeeper in Kensington Palace.

response: ** Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley
He was the father of the Conservative MP Henry Hunloke. His maternal grandmother was Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley, daughter of William IV of the United Kingdom.
* Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley (1796–1837), daughter of William IV

His maternal grandfather was the painter and art collector John Postle Heseltine of Walhampton. His paternal grandparents were Capt. Philip Perceval and the former Ernestine Wellington Sidney (a daughter of Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley, herself the eldest illegitimate daughter of William IV of the United Kingdom through his relationship with Dorothea Jordan).

* Sylvia Heseltine (b. 1868), who married Maj. Sir Philip Hunloke, a grandson of Sophia Sidney, Baroness De L'Isle and Dudley (the eldest illegitimate daughter of William IV of the United Kingdom through his relationship with Dorothea Jordan), in 1892.
